The New Senate Bill Is Still Unimaginably Horrible Legislation
Maintaining the ACA’s tax on investment income just fixes a really dumb political blunder.
The new version of TrumpCare substantially expands Health Savings Accounts, which are a massive tax giveaway to the wealthy.
And, of course, the richest Americans will be getting an equivalent tax cut later in the year anyway.
This is still a huge cut in social spending to pay for huge tax cuts for the rich — it’s just that some of the details and sequencing has changed.
The Cruz Amendment is a big deal, and would essentially end the ACA’s regulation of private insurance markets.
Under the ACA, insurance companies had to make money by actually providing insurance that covered things to all comers.
Under BCRA, insurance companies could go back to making money by selling people useless insurance and effectively locking people with pre-existing conditions out of the market.
The massive Medicaid cuts are still there too.

The Crusades were not perpetrated by Rome.  What's more, a "client state" of Rome means one that was colonized.  What possible claim could an Italian city-state have in the Middle East?   The Crusades took place in the medieval period,  long after Rome had been conquered, and mainly by what is now England, France, and Germany.

The Crusades were nasty and had no valid land claims to back them.  It was attempted conquest.

I think this one statement by Strader gets at why folks are supporting Trump.  Read it carefully:

"Trump complained about our mutual defense treaty with Japan and our NATO alliance, saying those nations weren’t paying their fair share of the costs of their defense. But earlier, when Clinton asked why Trump wasn’t paying his fair share of federal taxes to support American troops, he said he was just being smart."

Translation:  Japan and NATO are smart, Trump is smart, US political leaders are naive amateurs playing in a game that is beyond them, they are the "mark".  Trump supporters drive home point, politicians have failed us miserably as we can see, give a non-politician a chance to make things better.

I'm not so sure if I were Hillary, I would take Srader's advice for debating on a national stage.  This one alone sets her up for a real "zinger".  Maybe Srader is a closet Trump supporter?

I graduated from nursing school in 1972. At that time we focused on preventative care and had many satellite clinics located in many communities with the objective of keeping citizens out of the Emergency Room for their health care. The health care system was set up to prevent people from getting sick in the first place with education on lifestyle and halting the progress of chronic conditions. That started to change in the 1980's when new technology and medications were developed and were expensive. We went from a nation of being pr0-active on preventing and controlling disease conditions to "what the heck", get or prevent a disease by taking a pill. Just watch the adds for medications on tv.   Chronic heartburn is best treated by diet and losing weight. Who is the man on tv who promotes the over the counter medication for "frequent" heartburn, he is obese, and eats all the heartburn triggers that will lead to a life long disease, GERD, and a lifetime of medical treatment.

Immigration is not a bad thing unless the immigrants are here only for the benefits that the natural-born citizens provide and pay for.  If the immigrants are here only for the benefits and reject the culture and traditions of the U.S., then we have a problem... a severe problem.

@Miss...One group overtaking another in pursuit of resources and territory has taken place on every continent in every decade since the dawn of time. The tools, mechanisms, and landscapes may change,  and, correspondingly so, the degree and duration, outcome, and depth of loss, but it's still the same thing: taking from one by another. By your logic, the wars that took place centuries ago weren't really wars because they couldn't wreak death and destruction on the same scale and with the same relative ease as is the case in the modern world. Similarly, by your logic, diseases today are less virulent because they don't wipe out entire villages/cities nowadays as they did years ago.  I'm sooooo tired of the white guilt thing, as well as the "only those in power can be racist" thing, etc etc etc.  And, finally, for what it's worth, I happen to agree with the idea that the Sea Shepherd crew is a ship of meddling fools who should take their do-goodery elsewhere. But the theft thing...naw.
